page.title: 14Trade in the Bramley area.
page.content: { Major influences}on trade in Bramley in the past 15 years were the{motorway (1km.away) and consequent urban growth with{new housing estates}and an{ {Industrial Estate.} 7 new housing estates caused village businesses to prosper, from grocery, bakers, fashion and DIY shops, to betting offices, florists, a Building Society, garages, and car maintenance. An Industrial Estate was opened across the motorway and this brought an influx of workers at lunch time. This, combined with long-distance traffic,has caused a{rise in the fast {food service.}There are now 9 places which, between them, cater for people between 7am and 11.30pm. There is a Hypermarket opening in{Oct {1985,}selling everything under 1 roof, and cheaper.How will this affect village trade? Only time will tell.
